item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure: Best Gifts For My Melody
item.description:
Summary

  • My Melody likes Sweet, Pink, and Dreamy items for quick friendship boosts.
  • Strawberry Shortcake and Pink Latte are easy, effective gifts for building friendship.
  • Pink Cloud and Sweet Cloud offer high gift values for fast progress in friendship.

In Hello Kitty Island Adventure , players can gift items to any character up to three times daily. To boost friendship more efficiently, certain gifts are more effective for particular characters. Each gift is associated with up to four tags, each tagged with a value ranging from 0 to 2 points. On top of that, each heart attached to a tag contributes an additional 1 point to the gift's total value. The total value of a gift depends on the combined points from its tags and hearts, which in turn influences the amount of friendship XP earned when the gift is given.

My Melody enjoys gifts with the Sweet, Pink, and Dreamy tags, making items with these tags a great choice for increasing friendship over time. She can often be found in her furniture store at the center of Seaside Resort. Building friendship with My Melody unlocks additional Visitor Cabins and grants access to two useful companion abilities. The first, Big Smile, unlocked at level 4, boosts the chances of receiving an extra gift from other characters when giving them gifts. The second ability, Handy Helper, unlocked at level 9, reduces the repair cost for each Visitor Cabin by one Strawberry Crate.

7 Strawberry

A Basic Starting Option

  • Tags: Sweet, Fruit
  • Hearts: 1
  • Gift Value: 1

In Hello Kitty Island Adventure , the Strawberry is an excellent starting gift for My Melody, offering an easy and effective way to build friendship with her. To obtain the Strawberries, players must first gift Pochacco in order to receive them in return. The simplest item to give to Pochacco is Tofu, which is provided by gifting to Hello Kitty.

Strawberries are a straightforward and reliable option to gift to My Melody early in the game, allowing players to increase friendship quickly and efficiently and helping them progress further.

6 Strawberry Shortcake

A Good Gift Without Requiring Machine Upgrades

  • Tags: Bakery, Fruit, Sweet
  • Hearts: 1
  • Gift Value: 3
  • Recipe: Flour, Strawberry

Strawberry Shortcake is another great starting option for players in Hello Kitty Island Adventure , as it can be made using the oven at the Hello Kitty Cafe in Seaside Resort. Itâ€™s one of the first recipes unlocked in the game, making it an ideal choice for players early in the story.

Flour is given by My Melody as a reward for gifting to her, making both ingredients required for this recipe easy to source. Strawberry Shortcake is a perfect gifting option for using up common resources, offering both convenience and effectiveness.

5 Pink Latte

A Good Value Gift Made With Common Ingredients

  • Tags: Cozy Beverage, Sweet, Pink
  • Hearts: 2
  • Gift Value: 4
  • Recipe: Candlenut, Strawberry or Sakura

Pink Latte can be made with either Strawberry or Sakura as the second ingredient, but it's highly recommended to use Strawberry. Itâ€™s easier to obtain and less valuable than Sakura, making it the more practical choice. Candlenut, which is essential for crafting drinks at the Espresso Machine, is given by Hangyodon once players gift to him.

The Espresso Machine itself is located in the Comedy Club at Rainbow Reef. While players will need to unlock the snorkel to reach this underwater area, thereâ€™s a Fast Travel Mailbox nearby, so no Stamina Apples are needed to get there.

4 Pink Cloud

A Strong Option Once Cloud Island Is Unlocked

  • Tags: Cloud, Dreamy, Pink
  • Hearts: 2
  • Gift Value: 6
  • Recipe: Candy Cloud, Strawberry or Sakura

Slightly more difficult to obtain than previous gifting options, the Pink Cloud is a food item made at the Candy Cloud Machine on Cloud Island. To access Cloud Island, players must first complete the "Stargazing" quest from Hello Kitty, which becomes available after finishing the "A Challenging Rescue" and "Bakerâ€™s Assistant" quests. To use the Candy Cloud Machine, players must reach level 2 friendship with Lala and complete the "Sweet in the Stars" quest.

Like the Pink Latte, the Pink Cloud can be made with either Strawberry or Sakura. By this point in the game, players will have unlocked Merry Meadow, where they can harvest 22 Sakura daily, so the choice of ingredient is up to personal preference. Candy Clouds are also easy to acquire, as they are a return gift from Cinamoroll.

3 Sweet Cloud

A Slightly More Convenient Cloud Gift Option

  • Tags: Cloud, Dreamy, Dessert
  • Hearts: 1
  • Gift Value: 6
  • Recipe: Candy Cloud, Swampmallow or Sugarkelp

Sweet Cloud, like the Pink Cloud, is crafted using the Candy Cloud Machine on Cloud Island. Both require Candy Cloud as their main ingredient, but Sweet Cloud is often the more convenient option. In terms of the second ingredient, players can forage for Swampmallow daily in the Spooky Swamp, which becomes available early in the game. Sugarkelp, the return gift from Keroppi, is also a good choice, but with 15 Swampmallows available each day, they tend to be the more efficient option for managing resources.

Both Pink Cloud and Sweet Cloud have a gift value of 6, making them excellent choices to gift My Melody three times a day for fast friendship progress.

2 Strawberry Almond Galette

A High Gift Value With Simple Ingredients

  • Tags: Bakery, Dreamy, Pink
  • Hearts: 2
  • Gift Value: 7
  • Recipe: Flour, Strawberry, Toasted Almond

The Strawberry Almond Galette is crafted using the upgraded oven in the Hello Kitty Cafe. To unlock the upgraded oven, players must reach level 15 friendship with Hello Kitty, which takes time and effort. However, as a late-game option, this gift is ideal due to its simple ingredients and the convenience of the cafeâ€™s location.

Toasted Almonds, one of the main ingredients, can be found daily around Mount Hothead, making them easy to gather in bulk. With no quests required to access Seaside Resort, the ease of making and delivering this gift to My Melody is one of its strongest advantages.

1 Pink Clouds Ice Cream

The Perfect Late Game Gift

  • Tags: Dessert, Pink, Dreamy, Sweet
  • Hearts: 3
  • Gift Value: 8
  • Recipe: Cactus Cream, Candy Cloud, Sakura

Pink Clouds Ice Cream is another great late-game gift option for My Melody. Itâ€™s made using the Dessert Machine in the Dessert Boat on Gemstone Mountain, located near the Oasis Fast Travel Mailbox. However, to craft items with three ingredients, players must upgrade the machine by reaching level 13 friendship with Pompompurin.

Cactus Cream, one of the main ingredients, can be found daily around Gemstone Mountain, with up to 12 available. The other ingredients are also easy to acquire, making this gift a fairly accessible choice for late-game players. With a high gift value of 8 and simple-to-gather materials, Pink Clouds Ice Cream definitely stands out as the best gift for My Melody.

item.title: Pokemon Releases New Eevee Kitchen Goods
item.description:
Summary

  • Pokemon is launching a new Eevee kitchen collection, featuring items like aprons, dish towels, and cookie cutters.
  • Prices range from $19.99 to $59.99 for Eevee-themed goods, with options also available for Pikachu and other Pokemon.
  • As adult fans grow with the franchise, Pokemon merchandise adapts to more mature tastes while still uniting fans of all ages.

Pokemon is releasing a new collection of baking and cooking goods with Eevee designs. The adorable collection would fit well in any Pokemon fan's kitchen.

Pokemon regularly announces and releases new merchandise featuring fan-favorite pocket monsters, with Eevee and its evolutions being regular subjects. Eevee fans can readily find items like plushies and toys, and even eBay is celebrating Eevee with a unique shop. For those who spend a lot of time cooking or baking, this new Eevee collection might be perfect.

Now, The Pokemon Company has introduced a new Eevee collection of kitchenware. The sets feature various images of Eevee, with some including both Eevee and Pikachu. There are plenty of items to choose from, with Eevee featured on oven mitts, aprons, bowls, dish towels, measuring tools, pot holders, and more. Pikachu and Eevee have also been featured on both cookie cutters and Pokemon pancake silicone molds, which make it easy to create a Pokemon-shaped pancake. One item that may also catch fans' attention is a wooden cutting board, which features an image of Pikachu and Eevee sitting side-by-side, viewed from behind.

Pokemon Kitchen Collection Goes Beyond Eevee

For those who are interested in the Eevee items, prices vary from $19.99 for the pot holders, silicone molds, and dish towels, up to the most expensive item, a ceramic Eevee mixing bowl, priced at $59.99. However, there also plenty of choices for those who prefer other Pokemon to Eevee. As the Pokemon series mascot, Pikachu gets the most love as usual, but Pokemon fans can visit the Pokemon Center website or retail locations to find a number of kitchen items featuring Pokemon like Fuecoco, Snorlax, Slowpoke, Lechonk, and Wooloo, among others.

As the generations who grew up with Gen 1 Pokemon have grown up and become adults, Pokemon has grown alongside them, with merchandise to match more adult aesthetics and needs. Pokemon now serves to unite fans regardless of age or location in a charming way. Despite numerous Pokemon emerging since, Eevee's popularity doesn't seem to have waned over the years, and Pokemon fans are still hoping that it gets the attention it deserves in a future game. It's been a very long time since Eevee last received a new Eeveelution, with leaks indicating that a planned Eeveelution was actually scrapped and never made it to eager players. With any luck, fans of the Pokemon can look forward to more involving Eevee than just merchandise in the near future.

item.title: Sea of Thieves: How to Catch Every Fish
item.description:
There are all kinds of fish to catch in Sea of Thieves , from Wildsplashes to Wreckers. However, it can take time to learn how to catch every fish in Sea of Thieves , especially with so many fish types and variants to find across its four map regions. Sea of Thieves also doesn't only contain regional fish, with some varieties only appearing under certain conditions like at night, in storms, and even by shipwrecks, to give just a few examples.

If you're just beginning your fishing adventures with the Hunter's Call in Sea of Thieves and want to learn how to find and catch all fish types , here's a rundown on all fish in Sea of Thieves , their locations, and their catch requirements. Longtime fans of fishing in Sea of Thieves may also appreciate having access to a handy reference point that details how and where to catch every fish in the pirate adventure game, including the most profitable ones.

Updated February 25, 2025, by Gemma Johnson: Sea of Thieves is a pirate adventure game that can also be a fishing paradise for fans of the activity. There are numerous fish to catch in the Sea of Thieves, from Pondies to Islehoppers and beyond, with some species only caught in specific areas of the map or under certain conditions. Of course, knowing how to catch every fish in Sea of Thieves is highly beneficial, especially if youâ€™re looking to make the biggest profits. Sea of Thieves Season 15 also introduced Treasured Fish to the game, giving you even more valuable fish to catch. If youâ€™re eager to level up your Reputation with the Hunterâ€™s Call, cook better food than burnt bananas, or simply want to relax with a spot of fishing on the waves, our guide on how to catch every fish in Sea of Thieves can light the way. This update details how to catch Treasured Fish as introduced at the beginning of Season 15.

How to Catch Every Fish in Sea of Thieves (All Fish & Where to Find Them)

There are 10 main types of fish in Sea of Thieves , and there are five different varieties for each type according to rarity and what time of day they might show up, such as at night. Each fish variant in Sea of Thieves also has a possible large Trophy variant that you can catch, which is their bumper-sized version .

While the likelihood of getting each variant is random, and you might have your preferred Sea of Thieves fishing spots, the table below details all fish in Sea of Thieves , their locations, and how to catch them:

Fish Type/Species

Fish Varieties

Fish Location

How To Catch

Splashtails

  • Ruby Splashtail
  • Sunny Splashtail
  • Indigo Splashtail
  • Umber Splashtail (rare variant)
  • Seaform Splashtail (night variant)

Found in most open water across any region , except for Ponds.

No bait is required, but Seafoam Splashtails are only found at night.

Pondies

  • Charcoal Pondie
  • Orchid Pondie
  • Bronze Pondie
  • Bright Pondie (rare)
  • Moonsky Pondie (night)

Only found in ponds .

No bait requirements, but the Moonsky Pondie is only found at night.

Islehoppers

  • Stone Islehopper (Shipwreck Bay, Sharkbait Cove, Crook's Hollow, Sailor's Bounty, Cannon Cove, and Fetcher's Rest).
  • Moss Islehopper (Ashen Reaches, Thieves Haven, Marauder's Arch, Lone Cove, Wanderer's Refuge, and Ruby's Fall).
  • Honey Islehopper (Discovery Ridge, Plunder Valley, Kraken's Fall, Sunken Grove, Crescent Isle, and the Devil's Thirst).
  • Raven Islehopper (rare, any large island).
  • Amethyst Islehopper (at night near Devil's Ridge, Smugglers Bay, Mermaid's Hideaway, The Crooked Masts, Old Faithful Isle, Flintlock Peninsula, and Snake Island).

Regular and Trophy varieties are located in the water surrounding the specific, large islands , as detailed on the left, except for Raven Islehopper, which you can catch near any large island. â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

None require bait.

Wildsplashes

  • Russet Wildsplash
  • Sandy Wildsplash
  • Ocean Wildsplash
  • Muddy Wildsplash (rare)
  • Coral Wildsplash (night)

Found in open water in The Wilds map region.

Requires Earthworms as bait.

Devilfishes

  • Ashen Devilfish
  • Seashell Devilfish
  • Lava Devilfish
  • Forsaken Devilfish (rare)
  • Firelight Devilfish (night)

Found in open water in The Devil's Roar map region.

Requires Grubs as bait.

Ancientscales

  • Almond Ancientscale
  • Sapphire Ancientscale
  • Smoke Ancientscale
  • Bone Ancientscale (rare)
  • Starshine Ancientscale (night)

Found in open water in the Ancient Isles map region.

Requires Leeches as Bait.

Plentifins

  • Olive Plentifin (base)
  • Amber Plentifin (common)
  • Cloudy Plentifin (uncommon)
  • Bonedust Plentifin (rare)
  • Watery Plentifin (night)

Found in open water in The Shores of Plenty map region.

Requires Earthworms as bait to catch.

Battlegills

  • Jade Battlegill
  • Sky Battlegill
  • Rum Battlegill
  • Sand Battlegill (rare)
  • Bittersweet Battlegill (night)

Found in water near Skeleton Ships or active Fort of the Damned , Forts of Fortune , or Skeleton Forts .

Requires Grubs to catch.

Stormfishes

  • Ancient Stormfish
  • Shores Stormfish
  • Wild Stormfish
  • Shadow Stormfish (rare)
  • Twilight Stormfish (night)

Located in open water inside storms , with some regional locations for Ancient Stormfish (found in the Ancient Isles map region), Shores Stormfish (The Shores of Plenty), and Wild Stormfish (The Wilds).

Requires Leeches as bait.

Wreckers

  • Rose Wrecker
  • Sun Wrecker
  • Blackcloud Wrecker
  • Snow Wrecker (rare)
  • Moon Wrecker (night)

Only found near shipwrecks or for the Blackcloud variant , near shipwrecks in storms .

Requires Earthworms to catch.

How to Catch Treasured Fish In Sea of Thieves

Sea of Thieves Season 15 introduces Treasured Fish to the seas, which are unique fish from regular and Trophy fish in the game. Not only are Treasured Fish even bigger than Trophy fish, but they also operate like loot items , meaning you can't cook them, eat them, or store them in your inventory. Instead, you can place Treasured Fish straight on the deck of your ship when caught ready to sell later, meaning that other players can also grab and steal them. You can catch different types of Treasured Fish, such as Treasured Devilfish , Pondies , Ancientscales , Stormfish , Plentifins , and Wreckers .

To catch Treasured Fish in Sea of Thieves , you must launch and complete either of the following Hunter's Call Fishing Voyages from the Quest Table on your ship:

  • A Pirate's Fishing Map Voyage - three Treasured Fish to catch near a small island.
  • A Hunter's Fishing Map - six Treasured Fish to catch near a large island.

Fishing Voyages give you a Fishing Map accessible via Quests in your Radial Menu, showing the location of Treasured Fish at either one or two circles or shoals on the map, which tend to be near or not far from either a small or large island. The Fishing Map also specifies the island where you need to find and locate the shoals, which appear like bubbles on the water's surface . Treasured Fish also glow at night , making them easier to spot if sailing in the dark.

A Pirate's Fishing Map contains one circle with three Treasured Fish to catch by fishing inside the circle . A Hunter's Fishing Map gives you two circles with three Treasured Fish inside, giving you six Treasured Fish to catch. After catching all the Treasured fish in each circle, the Voyage is complete. Helpfully, if you fail to catch a Treasured Fish the first time around, it will reappear in the circle, enabling you to try again.

You also don't need bait to catch Treasured Fish, so you can start fishing for them straight away once located. You also catch Treasured Fish using the Fishing Rod, just like when catching fish in Sea of Thieves in the usual way.

Most Profitable Fish in Sea of Thieves

How much gold you get for catching regular or Trophy fish in Sea of Thieves depends upon several things:

  • Whether it is a regular or a Trophy variety.
  • Whether it is raw, undercooked, cooked , or burnt.

If you can learn how to cook fish to perfection, you can get the most profit when selling fish to the Hunter's Call Trading Company, as properly cooked fish sell for more money, such as large Trophy versions of rare fish , which are often worth more money given their rarity. Some of the most profitable cooked Trophy fish in Sea of Thieves are as follows:

  • Trophy Shadow Stormfish - 16,875 gold
  • Trophy Snow Wrecker - 14,065 gold
  • Trophy Sand Battlegill - 14,065 gold
  • Trophy Forsaken Devilfish - 11,250 gold
  • Trophy Muddy Wildsplash - 11,250 gold
  • Trophy Bonedust Plentifin - 11,250 gold
  • Trophy Bone Ancientscale - 11,250 gold
  • Trophy Raven Islehopper - 3,940 gold.

Most Valuable Treasured Fish in Sea of Thieves

Of course, Treasured Fish can also be highly valuable in Sea of Thieves , especially if you catch certain ones. While you'll also typically get more gold if sailing as an Emissary, such as for the Hunter's Call, some of the most profitable Treasured Fish in Sea of Thieves are currently the Treasured Starshine Stormfish and Treasured Zest Battlegill . These are worth around 4,500 gold at base value and much more when cashing them in as a Grade V Emissary . Just be sure to sell any Treasured Fish you catch to a Hunter's Call Representative at a Sea of Thieves Outpost or Seapost instead of to the Sovereigns to ensure you get maximum profits.

item.title: Pokemon TCG Pocket Space-Time Smackdown Leaves One Card Type Wanting More
item.description:
Pokemon TCG Pocket has a lot of cards, and the amount looks to keep getting bigger. Proof of that can be seen with the game being updated with new expansions, with the Space-Time Smackdown set being the most recent. The latest packs have added many interesting things to the game, from new monsters to support cards people can choose to battle with or simply collect. Still, even with the additions, Pokemon TCG Pocket feels lacking when it comes to a certain card type, one that the Space-Time Smackdown set is responsible for introducing.

Currently, there are now 620 cards in Pokemon TCG Pocket , a large number considering the options it can provide to players. The content of the Space-Time Smackdown is partially responsible for that, with its packs putting in 207 new additions to the game. While it contains the monsters and item cards that people expect, it also brought in a new type called tools. These are basically items whose effects last as long as the Pokemon it's attached to remains alive, and while they're great, there are currently only three. Few they may be, their utility can help dictate the battle with proper usage, which is why they're often seen on nearly every deck. Because of how well-received the new type of card is and how much it can impact the meta, perhaps The Pokemon Company should have the next update focus on adding even more.

What Other Tools Can Be Added To Pokemon TCG Pocket

Despite being new and only having three as of now, tool cards can be considered mandatory additions when creating decks in Pokemon TCG Pocket because of the impact of their usefulness. Considering that the Pokemon franchise has many iconic items that can be repurposed into tool cards, there are a few ideas as to what could potentially be added in the future:

  • The game could eventually add in Leftovers as a tool, healing the Pokemon it's attached to every turn
  • Life Orb can make its way into the game, allowing its equipped user to deal more damage with every attack at the cost of also receiving some
  • The Eject Button can see some action as a tool, granting the Pokemon it's attached to an opportunity to switch out with another the moment it takes a hit and survives

If any cards are worth obtaining and spending Pack Points on, it's the tools. Hopefully, these examples and more will eventually be introduced, as so many in the Pokemon series can make their way into the game that it would be a waste not to do so.

Why Pokemon TCG Pocket Should Have More Tool Cards

Space-Time Smackdown's tool cards have proven to be game-changing, allowing players to overcome certain matches they otherwise would have lost. The game would benefit from having more as the effects each one can bring allow battles to be more unpredictable and engaging, ensuring a new experience with every fight. Also, more tools mean more variety when it comes to deck building, allowing people to consider things like adding more to help with their set-ups or using them to destroy others. So long as new ones aren't too overpowered and are properly incorporated to prevent breaking the already balanced gameplay, the card type can become a staple that can be counted on for fun and exciting moments.

Future expansions for Pokemon TCG Pocket will likely include even more tool cards, and it would be good for the game for them to do so. The game needs more things to keep its battling aspect from getting stale, and additional tools can help ensure that it never does, so long as they're executed right.

item.title: Path of Exile 2: Complete Soul Cores Guide
item.description:
One of Path of Exile 2's defining features is the sheer amount of items players are inundated with right from the get-go. From the dozen different currency types to the hundreds of unique pieces of gear to the many different unique currencies needed for specific scenarios, if there is one thing PoE 2 is not lacking, it's items. Naturally, understanding and remembering what each and every single item in the game does is not an easy task, especially for beginners venturing into the world of Wraeclast for the very first time.

A great example of this is Soul Cores. These are items that are introduced very late into the campaign, and players are given no guidance on what these items are, what they do, and how to get more of them. This guide covers everything there is to know about Soul Cores in detail. Here's the rundown.

What Do Soul Cores Do?

Soul Cores are a special type of Rune in Path of Exile that function exactly the same as regular Runes, i.e., being placed in empty gear sockets to add fixed stats to the items. They can be socketed inside empty rune slots just like Runes and can replace already placed Runes as well.

Like Runes, each type of Soul Core offers a different benefit to the player. The comprehensive list is detailed in the table below.

Soul Core

Weapon Effect

Armor Effect

Soul Core of Tacati

15% chance to Poison on Hit

+7% to Chaos Resistance

Soul Core of Jiquani

Recover 2% of Life on Kill

2% increased maximum Life

Soul Core of Zalatl

Recover 2% of Mana on Kill

2% increased maximum Mana

Soul Core of Citaqualotl

30% increased Elemental Damage with Attacks

+5% to all Elemental Resistances

Soul Core of Azcapa

+15 to Spirit

10% increased Rarity of Items found

Soul Core of Quipolatl

5% increased Attack Speed

10% reduced Slowing Potency of Debuffs on You

Soul Core of Opiloti

15% chance to cause Bleeding on Hit

10% increased Charm Charges gained

Soul Core of Tzamoto

20% increased Freeze Buildup

+1% to Maximum Cold Resistance

Soul Core of Puhuarte

30% increased chance to Ignite

+1% to Maximum Fire Resistance

Soul Core of Xopec

30% increased chance to Shock

+1% to Maximum Lightning Resistance

Soul Core of Topotante

Attacks with this Weapon Penetrate 15% Elemental Resistances

15% increased Elemental Ailment Threshold

Soul Core of Ticaba

+12% to Critical Damage Bonus

Hits against you have 10% reduced Critical Damage Bonus

Soul Core of Cholotl

Convert 20% of Requirements to Dexterity

Convert 20% of Requirements to Dexterity

Soul Core of Atmohua

Convert 20% of Requirements to Strength

Convert 20% of Requirements to Strength

Soul Core of Zantipi

Convert 20% of Requirements to Intelligence

Convert 20% of Requirements to Intelligence

Even though they are harder to obtain than Runes, Soul Cores are not necessarily better. They just offer more options to add on to gear.

How to Get Soul Cores

Unlike Runes, Soul Cores do not drop from regular monsters in Path of Exile 2 . There are three main ways for players to get Soul Cores. They are:

  • Trial of Chaos: Soul Cores regularly drop as a reward for completing floors in the Trial of Chaos. Regardless of the level of the Inscribed Ultimatum, players are guaranteed to obtain at least one Soul Core per run.
  • Currency Exchange: Soul Cores can be purchased via the Currency Exchange by talking to Alva in your Hideout. The exact price of individual Soul Cores is always fluctuating.
  • Trade With Other Players: Players can sometimes put Soul Cores up for sale on the officia l PoE 2 trade site for cheaper than the going price on the Currency Exchange, though this only happens very rarely.

Failing in the Trial of Chaos before reaching the end will result in all rewards that were earned up to that point being lost, including Soul Cores.
